dt: {bc}a diocesan bishop (as in the Roman Catholic Church and the Church of England) subordinate to a metropolitan
{bc}an Anglican or Episcopal bishop assisting a diocesan bishop and not having the right of succession

et: Middle English, borrowed from Anglo-French, borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}suffrāgāneus, suffrāgānus,{/it} noun derivative of {it}suffrāgāneus,{/it} adjective, "serving in a subordinate capacity, subordinate to an archbishop or metropolitan" {ma}{mat|suffragan:2|}{/ma}
shortdef: a diocesan bishop (as in the Roman Catholic Church and the Church of England) subordinate to a metropolitan
an Anglican or Episcopal bishop assisting a diocesan bishop and not having the right of succession

dt: {bc}subordinate to a metropolitan or archiepiscopal see

et: Middle English {it}syffrygane,{/it} borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}suffrāgāneus, suffrāgānus{/it} "serving, assisting, serving in a subordinate capacity, subordinate to an archbishop or metropolitan," from {it}suffrāgārī{/it} "to express support for, be of assistance, be subordinate" (going back to Latin, "to express public support for") + Latin {it}-āneus{/it} "performing (the action of the verb)", from {it}-ānus{/it} {et_link|-an:2|-an:2} + {it}-eus{/it} {et_link|-eous|-eous} {ma}{mat|suffrage|}{/ma}
shortdef: subordinate to a metropolitan or archiepiscopal see
